abstract: Facebook is directing its army of users to help translate other sites and applications around the Web.
snippet: Facebook is directing its army of users to help translate other sites and applications around the Web.
lead_paragraph: Back in January 2008, Facebook was available in one language: English. That’s when the company introduced a new translation tool that allowed its members to do the hard work of translating the site into their native languages. As a result, Facebook is now available in 65 languages, and a majority of its users are overseas.

headline.main: Facebook Offers Translation Tool to Other Sites
